function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Using YOLO for social distancing monitoring without considering its limitations and potential pitfalls","Impact":"Inaccurate social distancing monitoring leading to increased risk of contagious disease spread","Mitigation":"Conducting rigorous testing and validation of YOLO model performance for social distancing monitoring, and implementing a backup monitoring system","Technologies":"Computer vision algorithms for social distancing monitoring, backup monitoring systems","People":"General public, individuals in crowded spaces","Owner":"System developers, public health organizations, government agencies"},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of pedestrian detections and social distancing indicators","Impact":"False identification of social distancing violations or safe distances, leading to unnecessary interventions or overlooking real risks","Mitigation":"Implementing human validation and verification of pedestrian detections and social distancing indicators, providing training on interpretation of model outputs","Technologies":"Human-in-the-loop systems, communication tools for real-time validation","People":"Surveillance operators, public health officials","Owner":"Surveillance system operators, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Overreliance on single-model performance without considering the context and limitations of other detection models","Impact":"Neglecting potential advantages of other models and missing out on more accurate detection or monitoring possibilities","Mitigation":"Comparative evaluation of multiple detection models, considering the unique strengths and weaknesses of each model, and incorporating ensemble techniques if necessary","Technologies":"Model evaluation frameworks, ensemble learning approaches","People":"Model developers, system designers","Owner":"Research and development teams, system designers"}]}
